fields.description:
It seems I can't hide exact repositories from contributors or observers.
I see that I can restrict access to write to repositories and their branches, but how about read access to repositories?

To do it in current version, I have to create another project and move there repositories I need to hide from some developers. It's terribly uncomfortable.
fields.summary: Allow to hide some repositories in project to contributors or observers

fields.description:
Most (but not all) Atlassian apps have a version check to prevent users running old Stash servers with newer Stash-Home directory.

This can lead to instance becoming corrupted and also this wastes support/customer time.

*Stash will now warn users when they are running an older version of the code against a home directory but it won't prevent Stash from starting up.*
fields.summary: Do a version check of Stash-Home directory before intializing server
Remember me token expires randomly

fields.description:
This is critical issue for our organization.

We have about 271 projects in Jira.
Each project in Stash has exactly the same key like in Jira.
To prevent incoherence I would like to disable changing poroject keys and project name (optional).

I see this as two checkboxes in Stash system administrator panel:
{code}
[ ] Allow Project Administrators to change Project Keys
[v] Allow Project Administrators to change Project Names
{code}
fields.summary: Add setting in Stash Administration to disable changing project keys and project names

fields.description:
I just clicked [View comment|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/pull-requests/527/overview?commentId=2143] link from a pull request email and got a CookieTheftException on Tomcat's default error page. After I got that I checked my cookies for stash.atlassian.com and neither my session cookie (JSESSIONID) nor my remember me (SPRING_SECURITY_REMEMBER_ME_COOKIE) cookie were there. I've got no idea how to reproduce this situation, since when I went to https://stash.atlassian.com afterwards I was presented with the login form again.

{code}

fields.description:
The {{cs_indexer_state}} table (which represents {{InternalChangesetIndexerState}}) does not have a uniqueness constraint on its primary key.

Customers have reported duplicate rows in the table, which causes issues with deleting repositories.

# Write a liquibase patch to delete duplicate rows in {{cs_indexer_state}}
#* Must be run before adding the uniqueness constraint!
#* Ideally the liquibase patch should first find all duplicate rows, then delete them and reconstruct 1 row for each set of duplicates.
# Write liquibase patch to add a constraint for unique primary key 
# Track down the cause of duplicate rows
fields.summary: Stop duplicate rows in cs_indexer_state

fields.description:
If you use 'root' user to run Stash, then java can bind directly to 22 port for SSH daemon. But now Stash did not allow this:
bq. Port to listen on for SSH requests. Must be 1024 or higher. Please enter a value between 1024 and 65535

Please also allow to specify 22 port in SSH settings.
fields.summary: Allow Stash to bind SSH to a port below 1024

fields.description:
We ship Stash with support for running as a service in 64-bit Windows, but we haven't documented the process to get this working.

Update the docs: 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Running+Stash+as+a+Windows+service
fields.summary: Document process for running Stash as a 64-bit Windows service

fields.description:
If i setup LDAP integration (not delegation, full LDAP), and make some mistake in settings, synchronization service will started in any case. The database became full of invalid users, invalid groups. Millions of users and groups. This process can't be stopped. Can't be paused. It just evil.

The only one possible solution, kill Stash, go into database and disable service in table {{cwd_directory}}. Then start Stash again.

It is very annoying. Please make some dry-run mode for such «Imports», i not need dozen of users/groups in Stash Administration users/groups lists.
fields.summary: LDAP integration provides non stoppable Synchronization of Users and Groups

fields.description:
The 'SSH Base URL' accept only values starts with '{{ssh://}}'. So, if you enter in this value the '{{ssh://stash.acme.com}}' (i setup SSH port forwarding from 22 to 7999 using iptables) — then Stash will show on Repository page url:
{{ssh://git@stash.acme.com/PROJECT/repo.git}}, instead of {{git@stash.acme.com:PROJECT/repo.git}}. The '{{ssh://}}' scheme must be used for Git only if you use non standard port.
fields.summary: Stash not used short form of SSH URL

fields.description:
Will be very nice if Stash granted permissions to listen 22 port, and also provide common SSH access to host if user different what 'git'.

Otherwise, admin must setup HAproxy or iptables and rebind sshd to non standard port.

The idea is to replace standard sshd on host by Stash jsch SSH implementation.
fields.summary: Forward usual SSH shell sessions via 7999 port

fields.description:
I would like to be able to use the "code is committed" workflow condition with stash commits.  
Originally asked on answers: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/130050/code-committed-workflow-condition-with-stash
fields.summary: Support the FishEye workflow conditions

git: 1.7.11.msysgit.1
external database: SQL Server
webserver: apache

As long as these errors are not solved or there is a workaround, we are unable to upgrade to stash 2.0.x

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of December 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks to everyone for voting and commenting on this suggestion. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Bitbucket Server.

We spend a significant amount of time on an ongoing basis to determine our product investments in Bitbucket Server. Unfortunately, we are not currently planning to address this suggestion in the next 12 months. In the last 12 months, we've resolved 10 of the top 30 feature requests, and our upcoming roadmap includes a number of other top voted suggestions, including in-browser editing, improvements to search functionality, better JIRA integration, and providing an even better code review experience.

I understand that this may be disappointing, but we believe it’s important for us to be open, honest and transparent with our customers. Product feedback is collected from a number of different sources and is evaluated when planning the product roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Norman Ma

Product Manager - Bitbucket Server
{panel}

With the move from using jTDS to access Microsoft SQL Server in Stash to using Microsoft's own JDBC driver, a nice improvement to also make would be to allow selecting integrated authentication in the UI.

Currently, to use integrated authentication users must directly modify {{stash-config.properties}} to set their own {{jdbc.url}} value. This means it is not possible to migrate to SQL Server using integrated authentication, nor is it possible to select SQL Server during initial setup if integrated authentication is required.

When SQL Server is selected as the database, a checkbox for selecting integrated authentication could be added. When selected, the username and password prompts should be disabled/hidden and no longer considered required; any credentials provided in those fields will be ignored.

When integrated authentication is selected, the server should choose the correct {{sqljdbc_auth.dll}} for the JVM's architecture and include it in the {{java.library.path}} automatically. Currently, this step must be done manually, in addition to modifying the JDBC URL.
fields.summary: Add support for integrated authentication for Microsoft SQL Server

fields.description:
The following settings were introduced to prevent reflog expiry for refs/pull-requests:

* gc.refs/pull-requests.reflogexpire=never
* gc.refs/pull-requests.reflogexpireunreachable=never

This should have been:

* gc.refs/pull-requests/*.reflogexpire=never
* gc.refs/pull-requests/*.reflogexpireunreachable=never

As a result, currently the default expiry settings still apply to refs/pull-requests/..., which means that intermediate merge commits that may have comments associated with them are only protected for 30 days. The first gc after those 30 days will delete any unreachable commits, leading to orphaned comments on those pull requests (comments that should have diffs associated with them in the history view, but no longer have a diff to display).

Fix:

* update the configuration setting.
* create an upgrade task to update the setting for all existing repositories.
fields.summary: Git config settings for expiring refs/pull-requests reflogs are incorrect -> refs/pull-requests refs are not protected

fields.description:
Our pull request git work flow goes like this:

A developer performs work in a feature branch, and once complete, creates a pull request in order to get it merged into master.  The rest of the team (~4 members) all take part in a code review.  One member of the team (and not the author) is designated as the primary reviewer.  This person's job is to ensure that the points raised in the review really do get fixed before the code is merged.

It would assist our workflow if Stash allowed reviewers to indicate that they had finished the code review, even if they haven't approved it.  Really they're saying they've finished one pass through the code.  They may be withholding their approval because of issues they've raised, but they won't be making any more comments until the fixes are committed.

This helps the author by letting him know that the reviewers have looked at the code and have finished with their appraisal - letting the author make changes knowing that no further comments are likely to come in offering a counter-opinion.

This helps the primary reviewer to know that his colleagues have completed the review, but are withholding their approval until some issues are fixed.
fields.summary: Mark a pull request review as "complete" (separately from "approved")

fields.description:
We use Delegated LDAP, it creates users on logon, but if you setup email manualy in profile, then logoff and logon again, Stash will clean email from profile.

Our LDAP is using only for authorization and contains only login and Full Name, but email did not contains.


h2. Proposed solution

We add a new option (radio box) to the Stash Authentication UI:

* Copy new users on login. Set "crowd.delegated.directory.auto.update.user" to false
* Copy new users and changes to existing users on login. Set "crowd.delegated.directory.auto.update.user" to true

And then, when "Copy new users and changes to existing users on login" option is chosen, the user metadata (full name, email, password etc) should not be editable (since this data will be lost next time the user logs in).
This will fix https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-7332 as well.
fields.summary: Provide an option to configure auto updating users when using LDAP Delegated Users Directory

fields.description:

fields.description:
If you will perform git clone/git fetch/git push over SSH, then java process will take amount of CPU usage (~0.5 cpucore per request depending on network payload).

To reduce this load on CPU, you may to rename repositories on disk to it natural naming in form <PROJECT_KEY>/<repo_name>.git, not a repositories/<some_number>.

After it, system administrator may create symbolic link to this directory for user git to enable native SSH protocol to be used for access into repository.

The SSH keys from web interace simple must be copied into {{/home/git/.ssh/authorized_keys}} file. Every time then users added it.

To track changes from repositories every one bare must have pre-receve or post-receieve hook enabled with one send updates to Stash via REST or something other posible way.

After this will be done, the load of CPU must be drammatically reduced on network traffic from/to Stash via SSH protocol.

Offtopic. It very hard now to find a repository on disk to see whats wrong within it. Cos Stash even not added {{git config name}}, or something else identity to this bares.
fields.summary: Move SSH protocol from java implementation to native side
Default branch are wrong imported into Stash

fields.description:
We must disable Gravatar support in Stash, because of NDA issues. The referrers from our networks will be passed into Gravatas access.log and this affect NDA resttrictions.

We also need to implement simple AvatarService. That simple return 'http://acme.com/api/avatar/<login>/<size>.jpg'. I write this plugin, and deploy it on Stash, but this service still not visible from Avatars menu. After some researching i need to use more internal API to do this. I discovered AvatarSource, ConfigurationAvatarService etc. This stuff is on dard side of Stash API :)

Please add support to customize Avatars support from API or from Web interface.
fields.summary: Ability to add or replace AvatarService by plugin

fields.description:
User 'a' submit pull request with Reviewer as users 'b' and 'c'. User 'c' detect no problems in commit and pressed 'Approved'. User 'b' detect problem in some line, and put comment on it. Then user 'a' fix problem reported and send commit into branch that automatically update Pull Request. Now users 'b' and 'c' must review this commit again. But now, user 'c' already marked this pull request as 'Approved' and must be manualy clean this flag, recheck commit, and set up 'Approved' again. It make noise in History of pull request actions.

Will be fine to have Approved on files, percentage, and also auto reset Approving from entire Pull Request and from Changed files by upcoming commits.
fields.summary: Automatical reset Approve status after incoming commit

fields.description:
When trying to clone my repo in stash from linux or when trying to connect to it on fisheye (also running on linux), I get the error in the attached screenshot (both in command line and from fisheye).

When I clone the repo using git from my windows or OSX machine, it works fine.
fields.summary: Unable to connect to Stash with fisheye or linux command line

fields.description: When I receive an e-mail in Stash that is related to a pull request, I see the repository name and the pull request subject, but I don't see the action that was taken, for example, Merged. When a pull request is merged I don't need to perform an action, I don't want to have to open the e-mail to see that it's merged, that should be part of the subject.

fields.description:
I wanted to create an application link between Stash and JIRA. Both run behind an individual Apache SSL proxy (stash.company.com and jira.company.com). The Apache server uses GnuTLS / SNI (Server Name Indication) to provide the required reverse proxy instances using one single ip address.

Both with Java 6 and 7, Stash is not able to establish a secure connection (Stash reports it could not connect to the server). However, using a reasonably modern browser, I am perfectly able to access both applications via https (https://stash.company.com/ and https://jira.company.com/).

With Java 6, this failes with the following Apache error log message: "Invalid method in request \x80e\x01\x03\x01". This is because Java 6 does not implement SNI.

Therefore, I upgraded to Java 7 which implements SNI. Unfortunately, then I get the following Apache error message: "Invalid method in request \x16\x03\x01". Thus, Stash still does not make a proper request.

Unfortunately, it seems that Jakarta Commons-HttpClient currently does not support SNI, see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1119 for details.

Attempting to connect to SNI enabled host 'expectedhost' over SSL using http client could also result in an SSLException similar to:
{noformat}
javax.net.ssl.SSLException: hostname in certificate didn't match: <expectedhost> != <defaulthost>
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:220)
{noformat}

----
h4. Workaround for creating applinks between JIRA and Stash:
Please refer to [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40968?focusedCommentId=690919&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-690919] by Christopher S. Hebert.

(/) The key point is to use localhost as Application URLs, while keeping HTTPS as Display and Base URLs, in both JIRA and Stash.
fields.summary: SNI not supported

fields.description:
The plugin works fine when the stash is setup with the right UPM already, but it is not fine with a clean stash loaded after an atlas-clean has been run on the directory.

Not only does the plugin fail to load, but the Stash fails to load also and I'm redirected to:
!stashfatal.png!

I find this problem regardless of which upm version I indicate. I've tried whichever one comes with the stash, 2.7.8, and 2.7.10. Doesn't seem to matter what the pom says. Currently, I have it setup like so:
{code}
    <properties>
        <stash.version>1.2.4</stash.version>
        <stash.data.version>1.2.4</stash.data.version>
        <amps.version>4.1.2</amps.version>
        <plugin.testrunner.version>1.1</plugin.testrunner.version>          
<atlassian.templaterenderer.version>1.0.5</atlassian.templaterenderer.ve
rsion>  
         <appfusions.product.name>Stash Connector for IBM Sametime</appfusions.product.name>
     <upm.license.compatibility.version>2.7.10</upm.license.compatibility.ver
sion>
        <sal.api.version>2.4.0</sal.api.version>
    </properties>

{code}
The only workaround I've found is to comment out the UPM code from the plugin, launch the stash, install the latest UPM directly, uncomment my UPM code, and update with atlas-cli 'pi'. This is _really_ a problem for plugin testing. I've had to make do with using atlas-run-standalone in some cases to do basic testing of the plugin, and is especially nasty around release time. 

My colleague ran into this problem as well with a different plugin,  although he had good luck with just specifying the UPM version. I have not had such luck. His experiences documented here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/100333/stash-plugin-with-license-api-failed-to-parse-auditlogentry

I'm using the latest atlas-sdk (4.1.2) and I found this problem occurred with 4.1.1 as well.

fields.description:

They always show localhost:

http://lsimone@localhost:7990/stash/scm/GIS/repo.git 

but on Base URL I have: http://lugvapsts014.lugano.ch/stash
fields.summary: Bad Base url

fields.description:
A reported a problem with cloning repositories via HTTP with recent versions of Git.

Either due to a change in git or a particular version of libcurl git was compiled against the {{Not Authenticated}} String Stash sends back to the client causes git to not identify the repository as supporting the smart HTTP protocol.

Symptoms: a clone attempt aborts with

{code}
fatal: http://user@example.com:7990/scm/PROJECT/repo.git/info/refs not valid: is this a git repository?
{code}

To workaround this problem, Stash should supply an empty response body when returning a 401 to the git client.
fields.summary: Shouldn't supply a response body to Git clients when returning 401 response
Hard to tell if watching a pull request

fields.description:
After inspecting the traffic all avatars except the one for the user that opened the pull request are loaded via https.
Only the avatar at the bottom is loaded via http, resulting in a browser security warning.
fields.summary: Avatar is loaded via http instead of https

fields.description:
CodeCollaborator has a great feature that allows users to "subscribe" (force reviewer status) if any of the files in the PRs match a file path pattern (with wildcards) or are sourced by certain authors.
See screenshots for the configuration tabs on this request.
-MPK
fields.summary: Allow Stash users to subscribe to PRs based on author or file path regexp patterns

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to reference Pull Requests in comments by using something like '#123' which would be automatically replaced by a link to PR #123 in the same repo. Would also be useful to autolink Jira issues in the same way.

Similar to what [github provides|http://github.github.com/github-flavored-markdown/] (see "A bit of the GitHub spice")
fields.summary: Ability to reference Pull Requests from comments

fields.description: Right now this functionality is only supported by "Stash Commenter" plugin, this should be supported first class by Stash.
fields.summary: Stash should support commenting on lines of code merged without a pull request

fields.description: When trying to view what changed in a commit you have to click on each file one by one to see the diffs. It would be nice to have a fisheye style view where by default you can see the snippets of all the files and their changes in one scrollable view.
fields.summary: On the commits page I should be able to get an "all changes" view

fields.description: It would be helpful for companies with gated code review processes (where say 5 developers have merge permissions) that they still have to submit pull requests and have another dev merge them into the main branch vs being able to merge in directly. This covers the case you want to make sure someone has OK'd the code to be merged in before it's able to get merged.
fields.summary: Add permissions to deny self merges

fields.description:
Stash doesn't seem to support the #comment and #time hashtags for JIRA smart commits. This would be extremely helpful in a transition to Stash

smart commit example:
"JRA-123 #time 2d 5h #comment Task completed ahead of schedule #resolve"

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+smart+commits
fields.summary: Support better integration for JIRA smart commits

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a side by side code review view vs the inline + and - annotations it currently supports

something such as: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+Side+by+Side+Diff+View
fields.summary: Side by side code diff view
README Markdown - support language identifiers

fields.description:
Our integration with Stash from SourceTree is having issues due to bad authentication through the REST API returning HTML. For example, if you do the following:

curl https://stash-dev.atlassian.com/rest/api/1.0/projects

It will return an empty JSON structure, which is fine. If you do the following, however:

curl -u fake:auth http://stash-dev.atlassian.com/rest/api/1.0/projects

You'll get a load of HTML returned. We expect a JSON structure with the errors as some other calls do. It seems if you provide any incorrect auth details to a REST API call you get HTML back. Without any auth you'll get a correct error back, though.

curl https://stash-dev.atlassian.com/rest/api/1.0/admin/users
{"errors":[{"context":null,"message":"You are not permitted to access this resource","exceptionName":"com.atlassian.stash.exception.AuthorisationException"}]}

As I say, we expect JSON back every time. REST API calls should always return in the same language.
fields.summary: HTML returned from incorrect auth details for REST API request

fields.description:
Hi,

Small feedback:

When I view the list of commits on a branch (https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/commits?until=refs%2Fheads%2Fissue%2FCONFDEV-13118) and I click Pull Request, I expect the Origin of the PR will be the current branch.

* It's not a big burden to change that because the drop-down has the most recent commits at the top (awesome);
* The competitors (GitHub and BitBucket) do the same way as you do and it's not practical either, so maybe users are used to clicking again.

Cheers,
Adrien
fields.summary: From the branch's "Commits" view, I expect Pull Request will be prefilled with this branch

fields.description:
It would be great to have a micro issue system for each Pull request. When reviewers add remarks on the pull request, they should be able to mark it as an ACTIONABLE. And others should be able to reply to it with a DONE message and close it.

When looking at a list of pull requests, a count of how many ACTIONABLES are still open could be shown, so that the branch herder's job is easier.
fields.summary: Track review action items on pull requests

fields.description: The user wants a hook automatically copied to the pre-receive.d folder of every repository they will create using Stash.
fields.summary: Configure Global Git Hooks

fields.description:
We would like to be able to configure stash to control the way diff handles whitespace. At the git command level, git diff has options like -b and -w to ignore whitespaces when diff-ing files. 

The use case which makes it a high priority for us is that different instances of IDE editors like Eclipse have differing default settings for tab/space conversion and for the number of spaces used for code indentation. Hence, when a pull request and its associated diffs are created in stash, we often end up with unwanted diff lines which only differ in whitespace. Thus, the utility of stash for conducting code reviews as a part of the pull request mechanism is drastically diminished for us.

To replicate the problem, create a branch with a test file that only differs from the develop branch in whitespace.
fields.summary: Stash configuration should allow the setting of low-level whitespace-related command options for git diff
